text: Mike Poulin (born December 17, 1985 in Kitchener, Ontario) is a professional lacrosse goaltender wearing #30 for the Georgia Swarm in the National Lacrosse League. He formerly played for the Calgary Roughnecks, the Toronto Rock and the Boston Blazers. He also plays for the Brooklin Redmen and formerly played with Kitchener-Waterloo Kodiaks and Six Nations Chiefs of Major Series Lacrosse. Poulin was awarded the Goaltender of the Year Award in the 2012 NLL season. In the 2014 NLL season, he passed Curtis Palidwor to become the all- time Roughneck leader in minutes played with 3,946. ==References== ==Awards== Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Boston Blazers players Category:Calgary Roughnecks players Category:Toronto Rock players Category:Canadian lacrosse players Category:Lacrosse goaltenders Category:Lacrosse people from Ontario Category:Sportspeople from Kitchener, Ontario
title: Mike Poulin
